meanings.definition: A device on a bicycle or motorcycle that supports it in an upright position when not in use.
meanings.sent1: The kickstand kept the bicycle steady.
meanings.sent2: I always use the kickstand when parking my motorcycle.
meanings.sent3: The kickstand on the bike decided to take a break and lay down instead.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was like a reliable kickstand, always there to support her.
meanings.sent5: The shiny kickstand gleamed in the sunlight, beckoning riders to park their bikes.

meanings.definition: To prop up or support something with a kickstand.
meanings.sent1: He decided to kickstand the ladder against the wall.
meanings.sent2: She kickstands her guitar against the amp after playing.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to kickstand the vase, thinking it was a good idea.
meanings.sent4: His words kickstanded her confidence, giving her the support she needed.
meanings.sent5: The tree's roots kickstanded the soil, preventing erosion.
